I expected a B grade horror flick. Instead, I got a well-scripted, well-directed, gripping horror. It has one of the best opening scenes in a horror film I've seen in a long while, and the rest of the film lives up to this early promise.I'm a horror buff and can happily recommend The Bye Bye Man. It's freaking cool.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the rating / reviews lead you to believe
reviews.content: I've seen a lot of horror films in my lifetime, and this one is neither among the best nor the worst. If you're a fan of the genre then I'm sure you've seen a lot of absolutely unwatchable films - this isn't one of them. Sure, it has some minor issues, but overall it's completely watchable. I won't go telling all my friends to watch it, but I'm not sad I wasted my time on it either. In one word, MEH.

I think the idea is unique and interesting, but it's ruined by bad direction and effects like something out of a TV show. It's so bland that trying to guess the tone is impossible, it's not serious because of all the dumb, unintentionally hilarious moments like when this guy in the opening shoots all these people.Bad Things:It sounds scary enough, but what ruins it is 1) It's shot during the day, so all hope at a scary setting is lost, if it was shot during a sunset or at night, then it would be forgiven. 2) The whole thing is shot in one take, so the already mediocre actors look even worse at their job. If they just shot the scene normally the whole scene would look and be acted more competently. 3) The writing is awful, so even if they did all the things I suggested, the scene would still be bad.The effects look like a TV show or something, I don't know what the budget was, but this got released in theaters and it looks like a TV miniseries or something. If you were to come across this on Netflix, it would fit right in, you would think this was another cheap Netflix horror movie, that's the level of quality were talking about. Especially the dog thing, it looked like a PlayStation game.The acting is pretty bad, it's not the actors fault, the garbage script they were given didn't really help them.It has a lot horror clichés like jumpscares, psychic goth girl, seance and magic thing that really works, scary library scene, claims to be based on a true story and so forth.Good Things:The idea is good, I think the idea of an entity that spreads through thinking about him and knowing his name is pretty scary, they should have chosen a scarier name than the Bye Bye Man though.While the acting is bad, there is one scene with Trinity from the Matrix (I don't the actors name) and this one guy who looks like Dane Dahan where the acting and writing are pretty solid. I really like that scene. I think the Dane Dahan guy can be a good actor when he's given good material and good direction and I guess that scene they accidentally got good acting.While all the digital effects are bad, the practical effects are solid.Overall, I think if the idea was given to a more competent person, this could have been a decent horror movie.

There are a few horror movies that are good to rewatch now and again, because they're fairly interesting and have something about them. I would put this one in that category.Never boring, the plot moves along nicely. The main characters work well and the overall acting isn't as bad as other reviews have said (I must admit the girlfriend is not going to win an Oscar though). The bye bye man is an effective nastie with a few tricks up his sleeve.Some have said this is a teen movie, maybe because I'm early 40's, I didn't know if they meant it has teens in it (most by the numbers horror movies are) or if it was a 12 rated made for teens horror, thankfully it wasn't the latter.Here we have a supernatural baddie vs a small group of friends and a police woman trying to piece it all together. Not original, but enough quality that it will certainly not be a waste of your time.

reviews.review_title: A SOLID HORROR-don't believe bad reviews
reviews.content: I watched this movie and the new Halloween tonight and I cannot believe Halloween has better reviews than this film. They should be reversed. This film has decent lighting, good jump scares, creepy scenes, and a good plot. I normally stay away from horror films with teens as main characters, but this was the exception. I watch horror films pretty much exclusively, and believe me THIS IS WORTH WATCHING, despite the bad reviews. It's no Silent Hill or IT but it is A SOLID HORROR FILM.

I tried to like this movie, I really did! But, like many of the reviews state, it's just not very good!
I have liked Carrie Anne Moss since the Matrix, but even her small part in the movie was awful.
The acting is dire, the story pointless and tedious with no explanation as to why The Bye Bye Man exists. There is nothing remotely scary about the film at all.
Honestly, don't waste your time watching this.
2/10

reviews.review_title: The Bye Bye Man review by Hogan Coad
reviews.content: I can say with the upmost confidence that The Bye Bye Man is a movie I will remember for a long time for all the wrong reasons. This is easily one of the worst horror films I've seen in a long time. As I type this review, my head is still spinning from the sheer stupidity I've witnessed. If you notice terrible grammar and poor sentence structure in this review, it's most likely due to the amount of brain cells this movie extracted from me. The film is about three teenagers who've recently purchased a creepy old house that Elvis Presley would sing about in his song "In the Ghetto". When our protagonist finds a nightstand with "The Bye Bye Man" sketched on the inside, paranormal occurrences begin to happen all over the house. Basically if anyone says or thinks "The Bye Bye Man", he and his poorly rendered CGI Rottweiler will kill them. I realize that was a terrible synopsis, but it was a terrible movie and I just want to tear it apart now. The acting in this film is absolutely dreadful. All of the written dialogue and onscreen chemistry resembled a film you would see on the sci-fi channel on Tuesday night. The plot is equally terrible if not worse. For example, there's a scene where the main character wants to research the bye bye man to find out what exactly he is. Well since the film takes place in 2017, he naturally goes to the library.....the library. There is literally a shot earlier in the film displaying an iMac. Apparently the film wants to be set in the 50s. There's also a recurring nuisance in which the characters say exactly what they're thinking while they're performing an action. And by "recurring" I mean literally all the time. I also think it goes without saying that we never learn anything about the bye bye man. His story, motive, high school years, favorite ice cream flavor at Ben & Jerry's, none of it is revealed. On the bright side, the terrible acting, scares, and effects can be so terrible that they're laughable. If you ever find yourself hanging out with a bunch of friends and you're in the mood to just ridicule a god awful film, this is definitely one to check out. But if you're looking for any other reason to watch it, the best advice I can give is don't see it, don't think it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as these reviews say
reviews.content: This is a solid B movie. There are great moments that are creepy, the story is decent, acting isn't as bad as everyone is saying. There are a lot of great actors in here.Lucien Laviscount who's in the Snatch series, Michael Trucco from BSG! Douglas smith does a great job. It was creepy but had some eh moments. I'd def watch a part two!

Watched this with zero expectations, just hoping to see a relatively good halloween-flick like Scream, but damn this movie really was bad. Very poor story with extremly bad acting.Dont waste your time here, move on and find something better.....period.

This movie is NOT that bad! I actually quite enjoyed it and it truly creeped me out during certain parts. People are too harsh on horror movies. Watch it for yourself and then decide if you agree with the 4.3 rating.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad. Worth a watch
reviews.content:
I went into watching with low expectations (due to average score on here). Its not brilliant and a must see but definately not as bad as it made out to be.
Not a bad story. Acting could be better by some (especially Elliott's girlfriend) but if you generally like horror movies its worth a watch. Odd few jumps and some parts a bit comical wierdly.. Certainly better than some of higher budget movies ive seen at the cinema.
Rated only to get the score higher.

Words cannot even describe how bad this movie is. People might defend it for some obscure reasons and that's fine. But don't be fooled into thinking this might be one of those "misunderstood" movies that people complain about just for fun. It really is that bad if not worse!

Though I don't entirely disagree with the reviews I've read, I do think that some understanding about the bad acting should be considered.Ninety nine percent of horror movies are always going to fall into the realm of B movies or worse. This is primarily because of derivative storytelling and average actors.If the actors were any good they would be getting better roles. These types of movies seldom give the actors anything they can really sink their teeth into.The girlfriend played by Cressida Bonas, this was her debut and really, what could she do with the part she was given? It's basically a walk through just be yourself role. There was no challenge to it.It's been said that a good screenplay brings out the best in A+ actors, A+ actors can take an average screenplay and make it seem better than it actually is because of their talent, but a bad screenplay will make even the best actors look bad.If you're a fan of horror it's watchable. If you're going to watch it like a movie critic you'll be disappointed. Movies regardless of genre are subjective. What one likes another will dislike.For example, I know people that absolutely love Sharknado. I think it's so stupid that I won't waste one second of time time watching it.

reviews.review_title: A compilation of jump-scares centered on a discount Spirit Halloween cape and a tired mash-up of ideas nicked from a dozen better movies.
reviews.content: Jerky skepticism kicks things off, but characters quickly start jumping to conclusions so they can explain to viewers a story that isn't actually happening on screen.

First of all: I've seen far worse movies than this one. Giving it 1 star would just not do the other movies justice. Yes, the actors aren't good, the story is pretty weird at times (read on!), the whole movie isn't played out great. Still it has a creepy atmosphere, most viewers may relate to the characters' emotions. In general it's your average horror flick to watch with easily creeped friends. You should just not think about it too much.The biggest failure of the movie is that it had a great back story and missed to implement the main plot:
It just never tells you who the bye bye man is! It rather tries to create another "Candyman" while it would be so much better sticking to it's origin "the bridge to body Island'.Spoilers!The actual back story is about a man who gets scorned and tormented so much, he seeks revenge, which then it turns him into a serial killer who travels through the states by train rather than being a "hallucination" that no one but Elliott, who has visions of trains for no good reason, can see.The dog is actually called "Gloomsinger", and was sewed together by the bye bye man himself to help him track his victims after turning blind himself. It needs dead bodies or it will decay. The bye bye man has no intention of turning students mad so they start killing each other. Also, why is not a single person in the movie questioning the dog who eats dead bodies?!The bye bye man is said to be pale (albino) with long hair, tattooed and wearing glasses and a hat. He's carrying a sack of organs. So it's not that bald funny dude in a scream-costume that can be seen in this movie. Also, why is no one in the movie ever mentioning that robe standing in their bedroom, turning into a vision of a hallucination of the bye bye man.Also, why do the characters never talk about their hallucinations but beat around the bush, taking about the bye bye man all the time without actually figuring out anything (like his dog, the train, the coins?) at all.The writer of the bye bye man may have misunderstood or just glanced over the original story or, and we know that's more likely, did change the plot in purpose, knowing that pseudo mythical events do buzz on most algorithms these days.
The original story of the bye bye man would have ended in plain old slasher movie.
But most of us would have loved to see that slasher movie!

Not sure about all the hate, pretty good movie. Just writing this review to try to get the rating up, as this film does not deserve the low score it currently has. Garbage name though, which I suspect is part of the reason its garnered so much hate.
I thought the acting was pretty bad and honestly kind of a stupid storyline. I don't think it's a total waste of time to watch, but I definitely wouldn't watch it again. Ending was predictable.

reviews.review_title: Finally, a psychological thriller about Emperor Palpatine!
reviews.content: I just saw The Bye Bye Man this past weekend and all I have to say is this had potential to be fairly solid but fails in almost every aspect. I went in not knowing much about this film, and I left with a lot of opinions to say the least. Let's organize this with pros and cons, because I just like to be organized.Pros:-There are some creepy moments to the film. It's nice to see a new horror/thriller use some suspense for once.-The Bye Bye Man has a ridiculous sounding name, but is a cool looking character. Props to the costume designers for that one.-A few performances were actually pretty solid, the guys who play the Bye Bye Man, Elliot, and John all do a consistently solid job.-It's obviously trying to be something along the lines of Slender and A Nightmare on Elm Street, which I think is interesting enough. I love classic horror, and The Bye Bye Man gave me feelings of not just Emperor Palpatine, but Freddy Kruger as well. He's an entity that doesn't really exist but is claiming victims through their minds.Cons:-Anything with significance is left completely unexplained. I left the theater with a lot of unanswered questions. Where does the Bye Bye Man originate from? Who the hell is the Bye Bye Man? Why does the Bye Bye Man have a dog or hellhound type thing? Why is a nightstand the most significant thing about this entity? What do these coins that keep dropping everywhere have to do with anything?-The film is only 96 minutes long, which I felt could have totally used another 15 minutes to just explain some things.-Although I was pleasantly surprised at the beginning with the suspense, it gives up on any suspense after the first half hour or so and relies heavily on jumpscares the rest of the way through to get any sort of audience reaction.-The Bye Bye Man's dog/hellhound type thing should have just been scratched on the whole. There's no explanation as to why it's there and the CGI is laughably bad.-Besides the characters I listed in the pros, the rest of the acting performances are kinda meh.-The film loses all of it's tension after a bit. Eventually I found myself laughing more than being scared.-The premise is kinda...meh. Doesn't make a lot of sense because you're not supposed to say or think his name, but how do you not THINK it? There's no real plot twist or anything to make the story interesting, the ending is a little flat and overall just didn't step out of any boundaries to be original. Basically meaning the whole movie is full of clichés.-Severe lack of transition. Remember when I said it could've used an extra 15 minutes to explain things? Tack on some establishing shots to that extra time. Scenes jump from one to another with no transition which makes the first half of the film retardedly confusing. We were a half hour in and nobody had any idea what was going on.-This was CLEARLY watered down last minute to try and fit a larger audience, nearly being rated R but released PG-13. There's a flashback in the beginning where people are getting blasted with a shotgun but there's zero blood to be found. It should have taken the chance with an R rating instead of trying to hang on to PG-13 guidelines, which probably explains why there's nothing that steps outside of the boundaries for originality.So, yes, The Bye Bye Man should have just been a straight to Netflix thing. Anybody who liked it in any sense can't give it more than a 6. I had to give it a 4, it's nice to get a refreshment of classic horror but the negatives greatly outweigh the positives. Would I watch a sequel? If it's done right and explains some origin or backstory maybe. It had the potential to be solid on the whole, but it never really makes an effort to go anywhere outside of it's comfort zone, or even explain anything that's significant to the story, not even the title character for Pete's sake.

It wasn't as awful as the other reviews would suggest. After the first scene that looks really cheap, it actually was alright. Was a bit of a cliche but I don't think it's trying to be the most serious horror film with a name like The Bye Bye Man. The acting was watchable and the storyline was interesting enough for me to finish it.

reviews.review_title: What Do You Want From A Horror??
reviews.content:
I can't comprehend the low rating. Is everyone trying to compare it to "The Exorcist" or "Poltergeist?"
That being said, this movie kept you interested. It didn't utilize cheap jump-scares and didn't go off on unnecessary tangents. I approve. Ignore the low rating and give it a try.

Not a lot of positives but I like the idea. Once you have heard or read the name, you are plagued with hallucinations that eventually lead to your death and anyone else around you who has heard the name. Evil urban legend. Not bad, not good, but it kept me watching.
Do not be fooled by the reviews! It's a great horror movie!
Actually not that bad. If you're a hardant horror fan. This is quite tame. If not, you'll probably be terrified lol. I wouldn't pay for it but free on Netflix. It's worth a watch. Enjoy

The entire foundation of this film, which is its story, is just bad. Take a ridiculously unthought-out premise and flimsy storyline, add in an amateurish script with some uneven-to-terrible acting and a godawful movie title--and the result? A pointlessly drab movie-going experience. Despite a few seedlings of interesting ideas, and one or two minor scares, this is a watered-down, bloodless and fairly scare-less exercise. The worst part, for me, is that it's totally un-smart. How and why did veteran actors Carrie Ann Moss and Faye Dunaway involve themselves in this project?

reviews.review_title: This is obviously a great movie compared to average horror movies...
reviews.content: This is the kind of movie requiring an advent into being sufficiently cultured in things such as mystery and literature. No, it's not your typical, nonsensical, thriller-alike horror fest, even though the cover might suggest such, hence the stereotypically literary acting. An horror movie might differ on the thematic approach behind it, and is not necessarily something meant to be simply "scary" for the so obviously fanatic masses, it might also be the object of curiosity for people interested in the occult, complexion of plots, or stigmas regarding the context in question. With all that said... This is obviously a great movie compared to the average horror movie! From the makers of the instant classic Oculus: Devil's Mirror movie, this masterpiece seems to enact once again plot twists worth the wondering. One of the funniest things in this movie is how, the character of another race looks extremely similar to Timbo, from the Oculus movie, adding this movie some extra ironic element and approach into it... However, it's important to beware of the nudity present within the movie and use some discretion regarding it, if necessary...

reviews.review_title: Terrible, but terribly good in a bad way
reviews.content: One of those horrible horror movies that make you laugh. Whether it's the bad acting, the boogie man storyline with a twist, the weak jump scares or the laughable kill scenes this is below average for normal movie viewers or a classic for B horror fans. Carrie Ann Moss must of really needed the money because this is not one you really audition for well maybe the other actors. The girls are cute so that's a plus

reviews.review_title: Ain't no lie, baby Bye Bye Bye
reviews.content: By far the worst thing about this movie is the title, which seems more like something from a steam game from 2011 than anything to be genuinely scared of. This entire movie is tainted by this, and removes any possibility of viewers remembering it with anything other than laughter.While this movie is conceptually decent, it fails to deliver over and over again as the 'plot' unfolds. What seems like a concept with a lot of potential for tension and lore ends up being a badly executed version of something we've seen over and over again, 'demon causes spooky hallucinations before driving its victims over the edge'. The movie seemed like it was going to give some sort of exposition or explanation of the villain, but ended up giving absolutely nothing other than what we learn from the trailer.The acting has one or two moments that pleasantly surprised me, but for the most part it was either lifeless, over the top, or just strange. If there were any reason to suggest watching this it would be so that you can witness the trip that is the acting in this movie.The movie looked good, and, with the exception of a terrible CGI dog that played no significant role, the villain and the scares were probably the most entertaining part of this movie. Doug Jones portrays the awfully named antagonist with an air of originality, and looked great while doing it.If you want to see what the fuss is about, be my guest. But don't say I didn't warn you.

I've read through a few of the other IMBD reviews and yes I see the point of the low ratings. But I thoroughly enjoyed the movie. It gave an intersting enough story and topic that kept me interested, and it had some real good pacing. I would best reccomend this movie if you want some thing better than just back ground noise but it wont blow you away.

This movie wishes to use the ethos of an urban legend style horror story (e.g. "Candyman"), but is only used as a vehicle for jump scares. 
The acting is sub-par, every character is a cookie cutter stereotype seen in every teen horror film from the 1980s onward, but poorly executed.
The story is dead on arrival, with an antagonist without any set mode of operation, and without any motive or payoff. All we know about the character of "The Bye-Bye Man" is the repeated ad nauseum mantra "Don't think it, Don't say it," but that's it. Apparently, it leads to your death, and the only way to get rid of him is to remove any mention of him anywhere. However, the only people who die are killed by other characters trying to remove any trace of the supposed villain. And in the end, when the villain actually has a chance to deliver some form of payoff...
He does nothing. 
Nothing in this film is engaging. The colors are muted, the camera work is sloppy, the special effects are not effective. But on top of it all, it's not fun. I love movies that are so bad they cross the threshold into good souly based on how much fun they are to watch. This movie doesn't even dip a toe in the waters of fun. It's all regurgitated cliches from better horror movies, and all done lazily. If there was a movie specifically made to make a paycheck, this would be it.
Its not a great movie but I've seen worse. Cressida is a terrible actress though. Shes not believable & is very mechanical. This movie has potential. Fill in the random holes & clearly a new cast.

I'm keeping this short and sweet as this film really dosnt deserve the time. It contains a VERY small amount of jump scares, in fact I counted 2 jumpscares in the whole 1 1/2 hours. It has such a ridiculously clique plot that really bored me to the point of falling asleep, LITERALLY. Also the acting is awful! It honestly felt like one of those school films made by kids. there are so many things wrong with this film, but I will be here all day - so to save the bother don't waste your time.
Dont read all these negative comments on here about this movie I believe that it was fantastic and scary!! Again dont think it, dont say it!!

Most reviewers must have sand in their vag. This horror flick may seem like it could be another throw away, but it is quite excellent. After watching, I was curious to see what else the director had made, only to find all these poor reviews.I had to write a review just to set the record straight. The movie was entertaining and moved quite well. It seemed somewhat fresh. Which can be quite hard for the horror genre. It's definitely one of the better movies I've seen this year.Good acting, well lit and an intriguing story. Worth every minute of its hour and a half length. Very creepy. It we'll draw you in from the beginning. Enjoy the ride.

reviews.review_title: It got me so scared that I couldn't say his name until four days later.
reviews.content: I want to start off by saying this might be a little bias. When I fist saw this on Netflix, it was night, the lights were turned off, and I was by myself. This reminded me of creepypastas, and I really like those.I really liked it. The chanting of "Don't Say It. Don't Think It." was really cool to me. The coins, the dogs, and the train horns were neat and unsettling. The fact that the curse of the Bye Bye Man affected everyone so easily like a virus was a really cool concept.It really spooked me, and I was paranoid for a while. I couldn't even say the name of the movie for the next four days. I watched it by myself twice, and I watched it once with my sister. She ended up hating it, but to each their own I guess.

reviews.review_title: In the first five minutes the main actor knocks on a concrete wall and it makes a crunching sound, that's how bad this movie is
reviews.content: Literally think of how little care the editors had to take to add crunching/weak wood knocking sounds in the first 8 minutes (7:40). It's laughable, I work in the industry this is a disgrace to movie making and art in general. I can't believe Netflix would pick this up.Not to mention all of the other horrible reviews. I cannot get over the fact that this man knocks on concrete and it sounds like he is knocking on a hollow, thin wood wall. Were the editors both deaf and blind? Legitimately I've been roommates with blind and deaf folks and they would never let something like this represent their name. The editing and production crew for this movie should be ashamed of the quality they were willing to put out and again Netflix should be ashamed that this is on their streaming service. Holy crap, it's bad.

reviews.review_title: IM NOT SAD TO SAY BYE TO THIS MOVIE FOREVER
reviews.content: Jeez the only thing scary thing about this movie is the quality just terrible! From the acting to the cgi it all just fell lazy and uninspired. I watched this film with my family and we predicted most every "Scare". It all just seemed uninspired to me it was unnecessarily confusing. And there were a lot of scenes in the film where there was nothing happening and I don't mean in the "wow this is so suspenseful" way the cgi and practical effects looked pretty bad to me and my family on our viewing of the film. The bye bye man is like Jason Voorhees if Jason couldn't use his machete and just stood there ominously with the power to make poeple see things and nothing else and with the bad effects mixing with this the bye bye man is almost comical. Now for the characters there all so ridiculously dumb they literally go into every trick head first and fail to come to obvious conclusions until it's to late. The acting is one of the worst parts of this really bad movie sasha's acting was particularly uninjoyable the only performance that I found tolerable was that of the character vigil. And on top of all of that I felt like there was this weird allegory for mental illness (like schizophrenia) and they even reference columbine while talking about the MC Elliot at the end like tf. Now for a personal gripe I don't how if it's just a problem with my TV but I could hardly hear anything unless it was a unscary Jumpscare and I turned it up to like 70 and ended up just turning on subtitles. But in short this movie was just bad I would not recommend.

reviews.review_title: Good fiilm to watch at home
reviews.content:
This film The Bye Bye Man was directed by a Stacy Title one of many female directors in the film industry. She is known for her films Let the Devil Wear Black, Last Supper and Down on the Waterfront. The Bye Bye Man seems to be Stacy's first horror film. "When three college students move into an old house off campus, they unwittingly unleash a supernatural entity known as The Bye Bye Man, who comes to prey upon them once they discover his name. The friends must try to save each other, all the while keeping The Bye Bye Man's existence a secret to save others from the same deadly fate.".
The Bye Bye Man consisted of many different symbols that constantly occurred. Some symbols that occurred in this film were a coin and trains. All these things in the film that essentially brought upon the demon/evil spirit. The coin could be a symbol of having two different sides of you. It could also symbolize taking chances because like everyone does as you "flip a coin". Trains where a constant symbol in this film because the train would be something those who knew the Bye Bye Man's name would see trains in their sleep. This symbolized the that he was coming The Bye Bye Man was coming for you like a train just chugging along looking for his next stop/victim.
A major motif that I found in this film that occurs in many other horror films were the steps or signs of this demon or monster. In The Bye Bye Man, some signs that the Bye Bye Man was coming/haunting coin flip, trains, dreams, the dog, hallucinations, "don't say it don't think it", psychic, and Ouija board. In this film, the main characters Elliot (Douglas Smith), Sasha (Cressida Bonas) and John (Lucien Laviscount) moved into this house on near their college campus. Once settled Sasha began to hear the sound of a coin flipping and doors slamming shut by itself. She was later told that the sound of the coin flip means that the Bye Bye Man is coming. The trains like mentioned before were another sign that the Bye Bye Man was coming because you see it in your dreams. Then that is another sign you start having weird dreams that just keep getting realer and realer every time. When finding out the history of house and Bye Bye man the students were told that if you hear or see the dog the Bye Bye man is also near the dog is the Bye Bye Mans evil side kick. Hallucinations is another motif that occurs in this film the Bye Bye Man starts to get in the student's heads and makes them see things that aren't real and going after what their weakness. There is a saying in this film that is repeated "don't say it don't think it" which is how you somewhat control the Bye Bye Man haunting you. A major motif that appears in this film is a psychic and use of Ouija board these two things are known for antagonizing the evil, awakening the evil and making the evil stronger. Many films like Nightmare on Elm Street, Babadook, Conjuring, and many more. All these films talk about signs and how the evil entity will appear and haunt you. For example, in the Babadook the story explains how the Babadook would haunt you. In the Conjuring the "demon experts" explained to the family the steps of how the demon attacks you and begins to possess you. The Bye Bye Man did the same it explained how the Bye Bye Man appears.
The Bye Bye Man was overall a decent film. It was good for it being somewhat of a low budget film. This films budget was approximately $7,400,000 this is kind of low budget for most films. The only thing that really bothered me about this film was the special effects. There were many parts of the film where the demons pet dog would be walking or eating people, and it looked super computerized. If I were to rate this film it would be a 6.6/10.

I find it very comical for those who find this a "good" movie. It is absolutely horrible and the main 3 actors are even worse. Just a horrible film all around. No one is capable of making good horror movies anymore.

I only have 9 minutes to review this film so I will do my best. To begin, it is troubling to see a film like this, with decent production value, end up being such a huge disappointment. The cinematography for this film wasn't groundbreaking but it can at least be considered 'solid'.As for the premise itself and the painfully unrealistic script, the same cannot be said.The Bye Bye Man is so devoid of anything that can be considered even remotely realistic. The plot is simple - which isn't necessarily a bad thing - but the plot points that fill out the storyline are just...dumb. The circumstances that motivate the characters to act are questionable in and of themselves and the responses that the characters have to their issues are boring and, once again, unrealistic.I can forgive a movie with wooden acting, stilted dialogue, and embarrassingly stereotypical characters if it is, at the very least, fun. Sadly, The Bye Bye Man is the farthest thing from fun. I will admit that I laughed at some of the serious parts of the movie, but not in an enjoyable way. Half of the time I found my eyes rolling into the back of my head because of corny dialogue or weird, unmotivated character actions.All in all, this film was just...not fun, not smart, not entertaining, and hardly original. If 2017 was the year when horror movies took a nosedive in artistic value, this was the film that helped to sink the ship.3/10 extremely generous stars...
